author: Special Correspondent
text:
Special voters’ camps to include new voters, exclude the dead and those who had shifted their residences out of Assembly constituencies and incorporate corrections in names and other details were held at 1,857 polling stations in Virudhunagar district on Sunday.

Collector V. Rajaraman inspected the camp at KVS Higher Seconday School. (Saturday). All those who had attained 18 years of age as on January 1 were eligible to include their names in the electoral list.

Dindigul

The next special camp to enrol all eligible voters will be held at all booths in the district on February 6. Eligible persons may submit applications for enrolling their names, according to Collector T.N. Hariharan. Inspecting a special camp for enrolment of eligible persons in electoral roll here on Sunday, all eligible persons should enrol their names to enable the District Election Office to prepare a flawless electoral roll, he said. Camps were conducted simultaneously at all the 1,095 booths in the district.

Theni

Collector N. Venkatachalam inspected special camps held in Allinagaram and Jakkampatti in Andipatti on Sunday. Those who attained 18 years of age as on February 1, may enrol their names in the electoral roll. Plastic EPIC would be issued to new voters, he said, and appealed to all eligible persons to enrol their names. The special camp was held at all the polling stations in the district.
title: Special voters’ camps held in polling stations
